Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Not exactly

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
You use terh AWS to spint up the starting nodes to create the blockchain... This has always been a hard part for users. Once the chain is started and the AWS nodes are used as seeds then it out in the wild and anyone can sync it and mine it. If people are using it and minieg it then the AWS nodes then can be switcvhed off.. 
It allows people to easily create lots of diff chains, with difffrent params, quickly and easily.

Author: Alecandro#1179
Content: That is so cool haha

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Using AWS now in my gateways tests - buying quite cheap spot nodes for a few hours, then in a few clicks spin X nodes from pre-created snapshot

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: No need to sync, no need to compile :troll_thuglife:

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: With KMD labs we made a way to notarise these chains with as littlke as 2 notary nodes, so you will be able to have dPoW for cross chain, contracts as stuff with it aswell.. Once I get time to go help them with it.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Obviously, using just 2 notary nodes is in no wayt secure... But for development... it is perfectly fine and very cheap.
